word: It is no time now [WRITTEN IN 1885, AT A TIME WHEN RELIGIOUS LIBERTY WAS THREATENED, MUCH AS IT IS TODAY.] to allow our minds to be engrossed with things of minor importance. . . . The Sunday movement is now making its way in darkness. The leaders are concealing the true issue, and many who unite in the movement do not themselves see whither the undercurrent is tending. Its professions are mild and apparently Christian, but when it shall speak it will reveal the spirit of the dragon. It is our duty to do all in our power to avert the threatened danger.
